info.title: Entrust Identity as a Service Issuance API
info.description:
The Instant ID as a Service Issuance API provides functionality that allows a customer to manage printers and to use
those printers to print cards, encode magstrips on cards and encode chips on cards. The Issuance API is available as
both a swagger file which is available as a link from this document and also as SDKs that can be downloaded from the
Getting Started section of the developer portal which is accessed from the Instant ID as a Service Admin portal.

Before using the Instant ID as a Service Issuance API, the customer must create an Issuance API application using the
admin portal of their Instant ID as a Service Issuance account. When creating an Issuance API application the customer
must specify a role that controls what capabilities their application can perform. The two default roles provided in
Instant ID as a Service Issuance are:

- Issuance Administrator - allows the application to both manage printers and perform print operations
- Issuance Operator - allows the application to perform print operations

When the Issuance API application is created, credentials are provided that consist of:

- the Instant ID as a Service Account URL
- the Application Id
- the Application Shared Secret

These values should be downloaded from Instant ID as a Service. They are required input to a client application using
the Instant ID as a Service API application.

The first step all Issuance API client applications must do is to authenticate to Instant ID as a Service. This is done
by calling the "Admin API Authentication" operation. The application Id and shared secret values that were downloaded
from Instant ID as a Service are provided as input parameters to this method. The method returns an authToken which is
provided as input to all of the other operations.

The Issuance API provides the following operations to manage printers:

- createPrinter - register a printer. Required arguments are a unique name and the printer deviceId. The new printer is
  assigned a unique UUID which is used to reference the printer in all other operations.
- readPrinter - return information about the printer.
- readPrinters - return information about all of the printers for this Instant ID as a Service account.
- deletePrinter - delete the specified printer.
- replacePrinter - modify the specified printer.
- getPrintersSummary - get a count of the number of printers in the current Instant ID as a Service account.
- readPrinterPreference - get printer preferences for the specified printer.
- replacePrinterPreference - update printer preferences for the specified printer.

The Issuance API provides the following print operations:

- print - submit a print job to the specified printer. The print job can include images to be printed on the printer,
  information to be encoded on a magstrip or APDUs to be written to the chip on the card. The print operation returns a
  unique UUID for the new print job.
- getPrintStatus - return the status of the specified print job.
- cancelPrint - cancel the specified print job
- updatePrint - for smart card encoding, send additional APDUs to the card.

Refer to the rest of this document for more details on the operations provided by the Issuance API.

post.description:
Create a new tenant for a service provider. Caller requires the TENANTS:ADD permission from a service provider role.
Notes on CreateTenantParms attributes:
adminUser (UserParms):
  • The locale attribute is ignored if provided. It defaults to English for the first super administrator.
  • The status attributes is ignored if provided. It defaults to ACTIVE for the first super administrator.
  • The userId is required.
adminApiApplication (AdminApiApplicationParms):
  • The spRoleId attribute is not supported. An error is returned if provided.
entitlements (EntitlementParms):
  • The contractMode attribute is required. It must be either TRIAL or PRODUCTION.
  • The quantity attribute is required.
  • entitlements.issuance (EntitlementParms.IssuanceParms):
  • The entitlements.issuance attribute is required if you are creating an Issuance tenant.
  • The serviceBundles attribute is required. One service bundle (of those supported by the service provider contract) must be defined.

401.description: Access denied

404.description: Not Found

post.summary: Lists a page of entitlement usage information
post.description:
Returns tenant usage information for the provided search parameters. Caller requires the TENANTS:VIEW permission. The following searchByAttributes are supported:
  • startTime: a mandatory String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • endTime: a String value representing an ISO-8601 date in UTC time (e.g., 2018-08-04T18:15:30). Allowed operators are: GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL.
  • tenantId: The UUID of the tenant. Allowed operators are: EQUALS.
  • isTrial: true or false. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • usageType: the type of entitlement: USERS, ISSUANCE. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
The orderByAttribute supports these attribute names: startTime.

401.description: Access denied

404.description: Not Found

post.description:
Returns tenants for the provided search parameters. Caller requires the TENANTS:VIEW permission. The following searchByAttributes are supported:
  • hostname: a String up to 100 characters. Allowed operators are: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • companyName: a String up to 100 characters. Allowed operators are: EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, CONTAINS, NOT_CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH.
  • contractMode: PRODUCTION, TRIAL, UNKNOWN. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • locked: true or false. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • serviceProvider: true or false. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • authenticationAccount: true or false. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • issuanceAccount: true or false. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
  • spIdp: true or false. Allowed operator: EQUALS.
The orderByAttribute supports these attribute names: hostname, companyName, contractMode, locked, serviceProvider, authenticationAccount, issuanceAccount, spIdp.

401.description: Access denied

404.description: Not Found

post.description:
Create a new tenant for a service provider. Caller requires the TENANTS:ADD permission from a service provider role.

Notes on CreateTenantParms attributes:

adminUser (UserParms):
  • The locale attribute is ignored if provided. It defaults to English for the first super administrator.
  • The status attributes is ignored if provided. It defaults to ACTIVE for the first super administrator.
  • The userId is required.
adminApiApplication (AdminApiApplicationParms):

entitlements (EntitlementParms):
  • The contractMode attribute is required. It must be either TRIAL or PRODUCTION.
  • The quantity attribute is required.
  • entitlements.issuance (EntitlementParms.IssuanceParms):
  • The entitlements.issuance attribute is required if you are creating an Issuance tenant.
  • The serviceBundles attribute is required. One service bundle (of those supported by the service provider contract) must be defined.

cursor.description: Identifies the page to return when paging over a result set--if present, search by / order by attributes are ignored.

limit.description: Identifies the maximum number of items to include in a page (1-100).

searchByAttributes.description: Identifies attributes for searching purposes. Some end-points have pre-defined values and ignore this attribute.

SearchParms.description: Parameters specifying search attributes or a cursor to get results from a previous search.

rank.description: A number that allows to sort bundles of the same category by precedence. Read-only currently.

usageReportId.description: An identifier used to report usage for this bundle.

ServiceBundle.description: A bundle identifies a set of capabilities available to a tenant.

allowedActions.description: A list of administration actions currently allowed for this smart credential.

items.description: A list of administration actions currently allowed for this smart credential.

cardDigitalConfigId.description: The UUID of the Card Digital Id config of this smart credential. If not set, the smart credential will not have a Card Digital Id.

cardDigitalConfigRequired.description: Indicates if the card digitalid config is required or not.

cardHolderDigitalConfigId.description: The UUID of the Card Holder Digital Id config of this smart credential. If not set, the smart credential will not have a Card Holder Digital Id.

cardHolderDigitalConfigRequired.description: Indicates if the card holder digitalid config is required or not.

certificates.description: A list of certificates associated with this smart credential.

chipId.description: The chip id of the smart card set when the smart credential is encoded.

deviceVerified.description: A flag indicating if the smart credential is enrolled on a verified device.

digitalIds.description: A list of digital ids associated with this smart credential.

encodeMsg.description: For smart credentials that have failed to encode, the encode message stores a message providing information about the failure.

encodeState.description: The encode state of a smart credential indicates if encoding has started, completed successfully or failed.

enrollState.description: The enrollment state of a smart credential indicates if all of the necessary enrollment values have been collected. Only smart credentials in the ENROLLED state can be activated.

expiryDate.description: For issued smart credentials, the expiry date is the date on which the smart credential will expire.

id.description: The unique UUID assigned to the smart credential when it is created.

issueDate.description: The date on which the smart credential was issued.

notifyEnabled.description: A flag indicating if notification is enabled for this smart credential.

platform.description: The platform of the Mobile SC application on which this smart credential was encoded.

scDefnId.description: The UUID of the Smart Credential Definition that defines this smart credential.

scDefnName.description: The name of the smart credential definition of this smart credential.

serialNumber.description: The unique serial number of the smart credential generated when it is created.

state.description: The state of the smart credential.  Only smart credentials in the ACTIVE state can be used for authentication.

userId.description: The UUID of the user that owns this smart credential.

userUserId.description: The user Id of the user that owns this smart credential.

variableValues.description: Variable values for this smart credential

version.description: The version of the Mobile SC application on which this smart credential was encoded.

SmartCredential.description: Information returned from the service about a smart credential.

allotment.description: The number of entitlements allotted to the current account.  If the account is an SP then entitlements can be allocated to child accounts.

consumed.description: The entitlements consumed since start date during the entitlement period.

endDate.description: The date when the entitlement will end.

overageType.description: The overage type of this entitlement.

quantity.description: The number of SMS/Voice credits allowed during the period.

renewalQuantity.description: The number of SMS/Voice credits allowed when the entitlement is renewed.

startDate.description: The date when the entitlement starts.

deleteEntitlement.description: If set to true when updating an SMSVOICE entitlement, the existing entitlement is removed. This attribute is ignored when creating an SMSVOICE entitlement.

endDate.description: The date when the entitlement period will end.  The value must be after the start date.

quantity.description: The number of SMS/Voice credits allowed during the entitlement period.

renewalQuantity.description: The number of SMS/Voice credits allowed when the entitlement is renewed.

startDate.description: The date when the entitlement period starts. This value cannot be in the future. If not specified, it defaults to the current date.

SmsVoiceParms.description: Parameters passed when setting the SMS/Voice entitlements of a tenant.

clientId.description: The client id of this tenant management.

defaultMaxAge.description: The default max age of this tenant management.

displayConsent.description: Whether this tenant management should display consent.

initiateLoginUri.description: The initiate login URI of this tenant management.

name.description: The name of this tenant management.

signingKeyId.description: The signing key of this tenant management.

createDefaultResourceRule.description: Whether an initial default resource rule accessible to all users should be created for this tenant management. This is only used if tenant management was previously disabled. If not set, it defaults to false.

defaultMaxAge.description: The default max age of this tenant management. If not set, it is not used.

disableSSODefaultResourceRule.description: If an initial default resource rule is enabled, whether to disable SSO. This is only used if an initial default resource rule is being enabled. If not set, it defaults to false.

displayConsent.description: Whether this tenant management should display consent. If not set, it defaults to false.

signingKeyId.description: The signing key of this tenant management.

SpIdentityProviderParms.description: Parameters passed when setting tenant management.

code.description: The actual temporary access code.  This value will only be returned if the administrator has the TEMPACCESSCODECONTENTS:VIEW permission.

createDate.description: The date on which this temporary access code was created.

expired.description: A flag indicating if this temporary access code is expired now.

expiryDate.description: The expiry date of this temporary access code.  If not set, it never expires.

id.description: The unique UUID assigned to the temporary access code when it is created.

maxUses.description: The maximum number of times this temporary access code can be used.  If not set, there are no limits.

numUses.description: The number of times this temporary access code has been used.

TempAccessCode.description: Information returned from the service about a temporary access code.

authenticationAccount.description: A flag indicating if this tenant is an authentication account.

companyName.description: The name of the company that owns this tenant.

contractMode.description: The contract mode of a tenant, allowable values = 'PRODUCTION', 'TRIAL', example='TRIAL'.

id.description: The UUID of this tenant within the service provider.

issuanceAccount.description: A flag indicating if this tenant is an issuance account.

locked.description: A flag indicating if this tenant has been locked.

previousHostname.description: The previous hostname of the tenant.

serviceProvider.description: A flag indicating if this child tenant is a service provider.

spIdp.description: A flag indicating if this tenant is enabled for tenant management authentication.

Tenant.description: Information returned about a tenant of a service provider.

authenticationAccount.description: When creating a new tenant as a child of the root service provider set this to true if the tenant is to be an authentication service. If not specified, it defaults to true. You cannot set the authenticate and issuance values to both true or both false. A child of a non-root service provider inherits the value of its service provider and if specified, this value is ignored.

companyCountry.description: The country two-letter code (ISO 3166-1) of the location of the company that will own this account.

companyName.description: The name of the company that will own this account.  This value is required.

companyState.description: The province/state two-letter code (postal abbreviation) of the location of the company that will own this account. This value is required for companies in the United States or Canada when the companyCountry attribute is provided.

domain.description: The domain for this account. This value is required when creating a tenant

issuanceAccount.description: When creating a new tenant as a child of the root service provider set this to true if the tenant is to be an issuance service. If not specified, it defaults to false. You cannot set the authenticate and issuance values to both true or both false. A child of a non-root service provider inherits the value of its service provider and if specified, this value is ignored.

serviceProvider.description: When creating a new tenant set this to true if the tenant is to be a service provider.

TenantParms.description: Parameters passed when creating a tenant.

results.description: A single page with the list of tenants found.

TenantsPage.description: Contains paging information and the results from a tenants search.

algorithmType.description: The algorithm type used by the token that was created or loaded into the system to generate OTP values.

allowedActions.description: Actions that can be performed on this token.

items.description: Actions that can be performed on this token.

appVerified.description: A flag indicating if the token was activated on a verified app.

deviceVerified.description: A flag indicating if the token is activated on a verified device.

groups.description: The UUIDs of groups to which this token belongs.  This value is only used for unassigned tokens. Only groups to which the current administrator has access will be returned.

items.description: The UUIDs of groups to which this token belongs.  This value is only used for unassigned tokens. Only groups to which the current administrator has access will be returned.

id.description: The unique UUID assigned to the token when it is created.

identityVerificationStatus.description: The identity verification status of the token.

label.description: Optional label to identify an assigned token: a String up to 100 characters.

lastUsedDate.description: The date on which the token was last used for authentication.  This value will be null if the token has never been used.

loadDate.description: The date on which the token was created or loaded into the system.

logo.description: Base-64 encoded logo. If a custom logo is provided by the customer it is returned. Otherwise a system default logo is returned.

name.description: An optional name for the token.

platform.description: The mobile device platform on which an Entrust Soft Token was activated.

registeredForTransactions.description: A flag indicating if the Entrust Soft Token has registered for transactions. Only tokens that are registered can perform token push authentication.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the token either generated when the token was created or loaded into the system.

state.description: The state of the token.  For most tokens, only tokens in the ACTIVE state can be used for authentication. Google Authenticator tokens in the ACTIVATING state can also be used for authentication.

supportsChallengeResponse.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports challenge response processing.

supportsResponse.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports response processing.

supportsSignature.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports signature processing.

supportsUnlock.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports unlock processing.

supportsUnlockTOTP.description: A flag indicating if the Token supports unlock using TOTP processing.

type.description: The type of token specified when the token was created or loaded into the system.

userId.description: If the token is assigned to a user, this value specifies that user's user id.

Token.description: Information returned from the service about a token.

count.description: The entitlements used in the aggregation period.

endTime.description: The end time of the aggregation period.

id.description: The unique UUID for this usage info.

startTime.description: The start time of the aggregation period.

tenantId.description: The unique UUID of the tenant.

trial.description: Whether the usage is associated to a trial tenant.

UsageInfo.description: Entitlement usage information of a tenant.

results.description: A single page with the list of usage info found.

UsageInfoPage.description: Contains paging information and the results from a tenant usage info search.

alternateEmails.description: A list of all the users alternate emails.

authenticatorLockoutStatus.description: A list of all authenticators that the user has with their lockout status.

directoryDN.description: The DN of the user in the directory the user was synchronized from.

directoryId.description: If the user was synchronized from a directory, the UUID of that directory.

directoryName.description: If the user was synchronized from a directory, the name of that directory.

directoryObjectGUID.description: The objectGUID of the user in the directory the user was synchronized from.

directoryType.description: The type of the directory user was synchronized from.

email.description: The email address of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use EMAIL OTP authentication and other features that require an email address.

externalId.description: An optional external ID for this user.  This value can be used to track the external identity of an Identity as a Service user.

externalSource.description: An optional value that describes the source when the user is synchronized from an external source.

fidoTokens.description: A list of all the FIDO tokens owned by this user.

firstName.description: The first name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.

frozen.description: Indicates whether a user is unable to authenticate due to inactivity.

frozenGracePeriod.description: Indicates a user's frozen grace period.

grids.description: A list of all the grids owned by this user.

groups.description: A list of all groups to which this user belongs.

id.description: The unique UUID for this user.  This value is generated by the service when a user is created.

lastAuthTime.description: The last time this user successfully authenticated.  Null if the user has never authenticated.

lastModified.description: When the user was last modified.

lastName.description: The last name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.

locale.description: The locale of this user.  If not set, the default account locale will be used.

locked.description: A flag indicating if this user is locked.

lockedAuthenticatorTypes.description: The user authenticators that are locked.

items.description: The user authenticators that are locked.

lockedAuthenticators.description: The user authenticators that are locked. Deprecated: use lockedAuthenticatorTypes

items.description: The user authenticators that are locked. Deprecated: use lockedAuthenticatorTypes

lockoutExpiry.description: If the user is locked, this value will specify the time at which the lockout will expire.

magicLinkEnabled.description: Indicates whether Magic Links are enabled for this user.

migrated.description: A flag indicating if this user was migrated from Entrust IdentityGuard.

mobile.description: The mobile number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use SMS OTP authentication.

oauthRoles.description: A list of all oauth roles to which this user belongs.

organizations.description: A list of the user organizations.

otpCreateTime.description: If the user has an OTP, this attribute specifies when the user's OTP was created.

passwordCompromised.description: A flag indicating if the user password is compromised.

phone.description: The phone number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration. It must be set to use VOICE OTP authentication.

preferredOtpDelivery.description: Preferred OTP delivery type (SMS, EMAIL or VOICE) or SYSTEM to use the system defined default.

additionalProperties.description: Preferred OTP delivery contact attribute for the given type (i.e., OTP_EMAIL, OTP_SMS, OTP_VOICE. An empty string means no override for that type).

preferredOtpDeliveryContactAttributes.description: Preferred OTP delivery contact attribute for the given type (i.e., OTP_EMAIL, OTP_SMS, OTP_VOICE. An empty string means no override for that type).

registrationEnabled.description: Indicates whether registration is enabled for this user.

registrationRequired.description: Indicates whether self-registration is required. This attribute doesn't apply to administrators.

securityId.description: The security ID of this user. The security ID is a unique value used to identity the user when performing smart card login to Microsoft Windows.

showNotification.description: Indicates whether to show notifications to this user.

smartCredentials.description: A list of all the smart credentials owned by this user.

state.description: The state of this user.  Only users in the ACTIVE state can perform authentication.

tokens.description: A list of all the tokens owned by this user.

type.description: The type of user.  A value of LDAP_AD means the user was synchronized from a directory. A value of MGMT_UI means the user was created in Identity as a Service. A value of EXTERNAL means the user was synchronized from an external source.

userAliases.description: A list of user aliases for this user.

userAttributeValues.description: A list of user attribute values for this user.

items.description: The user authenticator preference list.

userCreationTime.description: The time this user was created.

userExtraAttributes.description: A list of extra optional attributes for this user.

userId.description: The user ID for this user.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.

verificationEnabled.description: Indicates whether verification is enabled for this user.

verificationRequired.description: Indicates whether verification is required. This attribute doesn't apply to administrators.

User.description: The values stored for a user.  This structure is passed when creating or modifying a user.  It is returned when querying a user.

id.description: The UUID of this user alias set when the user alias is created.

type.description: The type of user alias. A value of USERID is used for an alias that will represent the actual user id value. A value of CUSTOM is used for aliases manually created by an administrator.  A value of DERIVED is defined for future use and should not be used at this time.

userId.description: The UUID of the user to which this user alias belongs.

value.description: The value for the user alias.

UserAlias.description: Specifies an alias for a particular user.

name.description: Name of the email attribute.

UserAlternateEmails.description: Specifies alternate emails for a particular user.

id.description: The UUID for this user attribute.  Generated when the user attribute is created.

mandatory.description: A flag indicating if users must have a value for this user attribute.

name.description: The name of this user attribute.

systemDefined.description: A flag indicating if this user attribute is one of the system defined user attributes.

type.description: Type of user attribute. Currently only used to specify the type of contact if the attribute is to be used for OTP delivery.

unique.description: A flag indicating if this attribute is intended to be unique.

editable.description: A flag indicating if this user attribute value can be modified.

id.description: The UUID of this user attribute value set when the user attribute value is created.

lastUpdate.description: The last time the attribute value was updated.

userAttributeId.description: The UUID of the user attribute that defines this user attribute value.  The userAttributeId must be provided when creating or modifying a user attribute value.

userId.description: The UUID of the user to which this user attribute value belongs.

value.description: The value for the user attribute.

UserAttributeValue.description: Specifies the value of a user attribute for a particular user.

lockoutDate.description: The date the user was locked. Null means the user is not locked.

lockoutExpiryDate.description: if remainingAuthenticationAttempts is 0 then a lockoutExpiryDate of null means the lockout never expires. Otherwise a value of null means the user isn't locked out.

remainingAuthenticationAttempts.description: The number of authentication attempts remaining before the user is locked out.

UserAuthenticatorLockoutStatus.description: Detailed lockout information for each authenticator for a particular user.

id.description: The UUID of this extra user attribute.

name.description: The name for the extra user attribute.

value.description: The value for the extra user attribute.

UserExtraAttribute.description: Specifies an extra optional attribute for a particular user.

applyGracePeriod.description: Indicates if the user is granted a new frozen grace period. This value is not used when creating a user. If provided, it will be ignored.

email.description: The email address of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use EMAIL OTP authentication and other features that require an email address.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

emailVerification.description: Indicates if a verification email message should be sent to the user if the user now requires verification. The user's policy requiring user verification must also be enabled for the user. If not set, this value defaults to true.

externalId.description: An optional external ID for this user.  This value can be used to track the external identity of an Identity as a Service user. To unset the external ID, specify an empty string.

externalSource.description: An optional value that describes the source when the user is synchronized from an external source. To unset the external source, specify an empty string.

firstName.description: The first name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

groups.description: A list of group UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these groups replace existing groups.

items.description: A list of group UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these groups replace existing groups.

lastName.description: The last name of this user.    This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

locale.description: The locale of this user.  If not set, the default account locale will be used. To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

lock.description: Indicates if all the user's authenticators are locked or not.

mobile.description: The mobile number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use SMS OTP authentication.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

oauthRoles.description: A list of oauth role UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these oauth roles replace existing oauth roles.

items.description: A list of oauth role UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these oauth roles replace existing oauth roles.

organizations.description: A list of organization UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these organizations replace existing organizations.

items.description: A list of organization UUIDs to be assigned to this user.  If specified, these organizations replace existing organizations.

phone.description: The phone number of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  It must be set to use VOICE OTP authentication.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

preferredOtpDelivery.description: Preferred OTP delivery type (SMS, EMAIL or VOICE) or SYSTEM to use the system defined default.

additionalProperties.description: Preferred OTP delivery contact attribute for the given type (i.e., OTP_EMAIL, OTP_SMS, OTP_VOICE. An empty string means no override for that type).

preferredOtpDeliveryContactAttributes.description: Preferred OTP delivery contact attribute for the given type (i.e., OTP_EMAIL, OTP_SMS, OTP_VOICE. An empty string means no override for that type).

registrationRequired.description: Indicates whether self-registration is required. If not set when the user is created, this value defaults to true.

securityId.description: The security ID of this user. The security ID is a unique value used to identity the user when performing smart card login to Microsoft Windows.

state.description: The state of this user.  Only users in the ACTIVE state can perform authentication. If not set when the user is created, this value defaults to ACTIVE.

userAliases.description: A list of user aliases for this user. Alias values must be unique with respect to the userId and other aliases of this user and other users.

userAttributeValues.description: A list of user attribute values for this user.

userExtraAttributes.description: A list of extra optional attributes for this user.

userId.description: The user ID for this user.  This value is required when creating the user, optional during update. The userId must be unique with respect to aliases of this user and the userId and aliases of all other users.

userPrincipalName.description: The user principal name of this user.  This value may or may not be required depending on configuration.  If it is required, it must be specified when creating the user.  If it is required, it must be specified when updating the user and a value is not currently set.  To remove the existing value, set the value to an empty string.

verificationRequired.description: Indicates whether verification is required. If not set when the user is created, this value defaults to true.

callbackUrl.description: The callback url of the webhook.

enabled.description: A flag indicating if the webhook is enabled.

expired.description: A flag indicating if the webhook has expired.

expiryDate.description: The timestamp of when the webhook is set to expire. If no expiry is set, this value will be NULL.

id.description: The ID of the webhook. This value is generated when the webhook is created.

filter.description: Subset of resource, or group IDs of the webhook event. All resources are selected by default if this parameter is not specified.

id.description: The ID of the webhook event. This value is not needed when creating/updating a webhook.

type.description: The event type set to trigger the webhook.

WebhookEvent.description: Information returned about the events of a webhook.

callbackUrl.description: The client callback url for this webhook.

enabled.description: A flag indicating if the webhook is enabled.

expiry.description: How long to keep the webhook alive for (in days). Value of 0 means no expiration. Once a webhook has reached expiry, it will be marked as disabled. This parameter is optional and is not set by default.

WebhookParms.description: Parameters including the callback URL and list of events to trigger the webhook.
